caption: The food was awesome!  The service was good.  I love the character of the old brick walls and the interior decor.  Highly recommend everyone try out this place!

Wonderful food, service, and ambiance. Fun to watch the chefs and food is fresh and local.  No Diet Coke or other sodas, so “when in Rome,” or Japan.  We love tapas because we can try so many different things. I was surprised, after making a reservation on Open Table, that a recent negative COVID test or verification of vaccine was required. Fortunately, we had that.

Didn’t take too much photos, but I recommend chawanmushi, pork belly, chicken (forgot which one), and the miso baby back ribs.  I really don’t understand the sukiyaki, don’t know what’s inside it, but the egg yolk is a nice touch. Feel like the A5 is nice, but for the same price I would rather go with the baby back ribs, personal choice I guess.  Overall a pleasant experience, I would go with the $70 tasting menu if I go there next time.

Service is perfect.  The food got some problem, had a dinner here, back home, having a diarrhea, hands and feet is freezing cold,  and vomited. Didn't know what's the cause, ordered a couple of stuff, the course, wagyu, chicken heart, beef tongue, avacado, pepper, uni tempura. The reason is I only had steak from costco for lunch, well-done, and some pineapple, but usually I had diarrhea right after what I eat.Guess might be some food not storing properly since it's super hot here, sorry for the 1 star but need something to be responsible for my vomit.

Everything was great! Soriresu was so good, and I was definitely also a fan of the uni shiso tempura, but my favorite was probably the camembert cheese!! Never seen wheel cheese on the menu of a yakitori place before! The novelty of it was fun, plus I love cheese 🧀💕💕 Drinks are nice and strong, and they have a lot of uncommon items like a sukiyaki skewer, and their kimo (liver) skewer is insanely buttery like foie gras! Highly recommend ✌✌
Best ever
Food is good, very juice fired chicken wings. But lots of dishes not available, bad experience.

Delicious, the chicken and egg are fresh from local farm; though the food is a little bit more expensive than other skewer or grill Japanese restaurants, worth the price. The dinner combo is a value choice.

What an incredible find. First thing to say is that each item is priced very reasonable to size and that my wife and i revisited the menu 3 times during dinner ordering at least 15 items. Each item whether entree or side was perfection both in taste and preparation. Sadly the Wagyu was not available due to imports from Japan being limited. There were also a couple options being sold out as it was later in the evening. We did thoroughly enjoy the chicken thighs and the corn the most but again hard choice to name. We also had the japanese cocktails with mint lemon and honey...so refreshing! I cant say enough. Service and food were hands down top notch. Thank you for the experience!
Nice ambiance, polite employees, great flavorful food..

This was more than food, it was an experience. Absolutely incredible food, service, and ambiance. Firstly, order the eggplant, it’s surreal. Secondly, the portions are perfect to try many things and experience a variety of items. Go once, then go back again.
Best japanese restaurant here
I terribly love this place! Meats are great, shishito peppers are beautiful! Hidden secret is cream cheese made of tofu. Request THEY! Edit!
Great service, nice ambiance & awesome food.
Always good and best

Awesome yakitori experience, akin to Japan. Nice ambiance and sake by the glass selection. The special chicken hearts were superb, and the tofu-cream cheese was an awesome dessert like finisher. Highly recommend.

Wings and the pork belly were incredible. The wings were literally exploding with flavor. I particularly enjoyed the yuzu one but my friends found it a bit too citrus-y. The nagoya-type was excellent as well. The pork belly skewers in all of the flavors were excellent. Unbelievably juicy. Service was great
Great food

(Translated by Google) I went out with my family, but the seasoning is reasonable, but it's a drawback that the prices are high and the price is high! It is the worst place to go to eat at night because it is the worst, so be careful. Be sure to go by taxi.  (Original) 家族連れで出かけましたが味付はまずまずですが物価高のハワイらしく飛び抜けて料金が高いのが難点！それより治安が最悪で夜食べに行く所では絶対ないのでくれぐれもご用心を…必ずタクシーで出掛けて下さい。

The food and service at Yakitori Hachibei deserves 6 stars, and is off the charts good. The menu offers much more than traditional yakitori, but their grilled skewered chicken is quite good. The Ahi tuna may be the best I've had anywhere, and all the small plates were lovingly prepared. This is unquestionably the best Japanese restaurant in Honolulu, and better than anyplace I've ever tried in Seattle, Portland or San Francisco. If you're anywhere near Chinatown in Honolulu, GO!
Absolutely fantastic best yakitori in town. Amazing!

Delicious food, excellent ambiance & service and not too expensive. I always had Indianized or Americanized Japanese, great place to try authentic Japanese. I will come back if I ever come to Honolulu again.
Love the ambience; love the food; and love the staff. Our second visit was just as good as our first.
(Translated by Google) Honolulu chicken is really delicious It is exquisite.  (Original) ホノルルの鶏肉は本当に美味しい 絶品です。

Does the air balance of a restaurant mean anything to you? Why is "negative air pressure" one of the most critical aspects of great dining? Well if you ever ate Yakiniku or Chinese cuisine you KNOW that you will smell like what you eat! So the moral of this story is FINALLY a high style yakitori restaurant in Honolulu that your beautiful date will smell as good as she/he looks. I digress...  Ok, on to main event. Master Japanese Chef from Nihon, check. Fresh chicken from Oahu, check check. Clean industrial design in historic Chinatown, Chk, chk, chk... and graceful Japanese service to sublimely compliment it all!  Stars of the evening? Any chicken skewer. Well for yakitori that says it all. But wow, get the tomato medley. A ice plate of ugly tomatoes! Get the beef sukiyaki skewer, yowzah, like a entire pot of sukiyaki (with enoki and mizuna) comes with a fresh (look at the height of the yolk) yolk. And I think a edamame kushikatsu? The final Joy is the chicken Ramen. How many chickens gave their life and bones to make that broth must be legions....  Hottest new Japanese restaurant in town.

(Translated by Google) I was looking forward to it because it had a good reputation, I was very sorry. A salty dish comes out, or a dish that is too thin to taste. The most hidden is the wings of the course. I ’m so sick that I ’m sick. The atmosphere of the store and the service of the clerk were good.  (Original) 美味しいと評判でしたので楽しみに伺いましたが、 非常に残念でした。しょっぱいお料理が出たり、薄すぎて味がしないようなお料理が出たり。一番ヒドイのはコースの手羽先です。病気になりそうな位しょっぱいです。お店の雰囲気や店員さんのサービスはよかったですが。

(Translated by Google) My daughter went for a delicious yakitori, a chicken that I studied with the University of Hawaii. It was delicious as usual.  (Original) 娘が美味しい焼き鳥、ハワイ大学と一緒に研究した鶏肉と言う事で行きました。普通に美味しかった。
As close as you are gonna get to eating yakitori in japan. Great happy hour specials from 5-6pm mon-sat
Hell yes! Intimate restaurant and staff was very and welcoming. I could not go wrong with anything I ordered.  My only complaint is Chinatown car parking but they got no control of that.
A bit on the expensive side but the food is quite good! Many small servings make up the Yakitori Combination choice
Excellent food and service. It was delicious!
(Translated by Google) Really delicious! I'm stuck with the material, and the service is perfect!  (Original) 本当に美味しい！素材にこだわっておられ、サービスも文句なしです！
Love, love, love this place! Meats are incredible, shishito peppers are amazing! Hidden gem is the tofu cream cheese. ORDER IT!AMAZING!
good food and people
Every dish to order, chicken hearts, take grilled perfect. Great service, put on your to do list. Even more fun second time! Grilled tongue, pig foot, fatty tuna.

(Translated by Google) Coco if you want to eat yakitori, which is expensive but delicious in Hawaii, in a stylish space. If possible, we encourage you to enter the Happy Hour 5-6. Happy hour is beer, shochu high is $ 5. Chicken wings and salads are also $ 5 a dish. Watercress sesame salad, flavored yam flies. Sesame kanpachi, small amount. Reba putty, 4 baguettes. hard. I do not think I will ask for the next time. Bovine tan curry, beef tongue is soft and delicious, but Rou is Bon Curry taste. Seats are designated for up to 2 hours. Because it is a Chinatown, there is no parking lot.  (Original) 高いがハワイで美味い焼き鳥を、オシャレな空間で食べたいならココ。 できればハッピーアワー5-6時に入店するのをお勧めする。 ハッピーアワーはビール、酎ハイが$5。 手羽先やサラダも一品$5。 クレソンごまサラダ、山芋フライ旨し。 ごまカンパチ、量少ない。 レバパテ、バゲット4枚。堅い。次回は頼まないと思う。 牛タンカレー、牛タンは柔らかく美味だが、ルーはボンカレー味。 座席は2時間までの時間指定。 チャイナタウンなので駐車場は無い。

Summary: Excellent food, recommend reservations, pricey for yakitori.  The food is excellent!  We ordered the prix fixe menu (~$50 per person).  You can order ala carte, and I heard happy hour is great.  It is very busy and a walk ins may have to wait.  You can reserve a table online ahead of time, which is recommended. Pros: - Amazing food (only average dish was the pork belly) - Good atmosphere and interior - Prix fixe menu or ala carte. - Have menus in English and Japanese Cons (expected for this type of restaurant) - Pricey - Expect to wait if no reservation - Parking may be difficult in Chinatown - Not open for lunch

(Translated by Google) High but is delicious. There are times when it is said that you should leave in two hours and there are times when it is not told.  (Original) 高いけど美味しいです。 2時間で出てくださいと言われるときと、言われない時があります。
Very very good..
Chic restaurant in a historic neighborhood of turn of the century buildings that is quickly becoming gentrified. Great sake selection and good food.

for local tastes this place would likely be great. yes, it is hard to compare against being in Japan and having a similar meal. for me, it was alright, just average; nothing special or unique. my wife is from there and she said the same. was really hoping it would be better based on recommendations from friends.
Love this place, having patronized the original in Fukuoka I can say they've definitely remained true to the original.  Service is great and the staff remembers repeat customers.

(Translated by Google) Because it is in Chinatown, atmosphere is peculiar. Cooking is delicious without any inferiority to Japanese yakitori. Since a little amount is large, it may be better to gradually order.  (Original) 中華街にあるので、雰囲気は独特です。 料理は日本の焼鳥と何ら遜色なく美味しいです。少し量が多めなので、注文は少しずつした方がいいかも。
the food was good but it took 35 minutes to be served. two tables of people came after us and they were served before us. not impressed with the service.
Everything was so good! Wish we had this in Seattle!

If I lived in Honolulu, I would not write this review because I would hate to crowd up my new favorite yakitori place in the US. If I could, I'd be here every night.  The true art form could be realized with the liver skewers - perfect softness while rich and creamy. This is something most places cannot achieve. Skewers are seasoned with salt before going on the grill and nothing else which brings out the true flavor of the meat. The shrimp skewer can be eaten whole, every part is delicious.  Hachibei prides on executing on traditional Japanese cooking art while iterating on the art with a fresh perspective.

(Translated by Google) Thank you for coming to our husband 's husband' s greetings (^ O ^) Salt · Soy sauce · Wasabi parent and child rice bowl chicken ramen yeah yeah (^ _ ^ ) /  (Original) すし匠のご主人のご紹介で来店 わざわざご主人さん挨拶に来てくださりありがとうございます(^O^)  ノース地鶏はもちろんのこと 塩・醤油・わさび 親子丼 チキンラーメン うんまい(^_^)/
Fantastic restaurant in Chinatown. Reminds me of a yakitori joint you’d find in Tokyo. The food is delicious and service is attentive. Be sure to sit at the counter for the full experience.
(Translated by Google) Yakitori excellence!  (Original) Yakitori excellence!
Serving

We found street parking! Good is consistently good. Their farm salad shrank quite a bit from the last time I was here and was too vinegar, though. My favorite is still the pork belly... So juicy and spices just right.
Delicious yakitori, beautiful interior, WONDERFUL staff. A new addition to my favorite places to eat on Oahu.
Delicious food and drinks. Prices are a little high.
This place is amazing
(Translated by Google) Yakitori  (Original) Yakitori

(Translated by Google) I visited for the first time with the introduction of the general of Waikiki Sushi Show. delicious! It was very delicious. It was two hours in no time.  Looking at other evaluations, there are criticisms such as high price, paid green tea, and it takes time to come out, but that is because it is based on the ordinary yakitori restaurant like a Japanese izakaya. Hmm.  The shop that the general aims at here is the same as the sushi show. We are trying to provide real satisfaction. The atmosphere and service of the restaurant is excellent, and it is a unique Hawaiian yakitori restaurant not found in Japan. More than half of our customers are locals. I am enjoying dinner without any premise image.  I will visit you again. Delicious, the best!  The last photo is a special chicken ramen. But it's not chicken ramen. A ramen made from chicken soup stock. I recommend it.  (Original) ワイキキ寿司ショウの大将の紹介で、初めてお伺いしました。美味しい！たいへんおいしかったです。あっという間の二時間でした。  他の評価をみると、値段が高い、緑茶が有料、出てくるまで時間がかかるなどの批評が有りますが、それは日本の居酒屋的な平凡な焼き鳥屋を基準にしているからに他なりません。  此処の大将が目指すお店は、寿司ショウと同じです。本当の満足を提供しようとしています。お店の雰囲気もサービスも最高です、日本には無い、ハワイ独自の焼き鳥屋です。お客様も、半分以上が現地の方ばかりです。前提イメージ無しで、ディナーを楽しんでいます。  またお伺いします。美味しい、最高です！  最後の写真は、特製チキンラーメンです。しかし、チキンラーメンではありません。鳥の出し汁をタップリ取ったラーメンです。オススメです。
Just go here. Trust me.

(Translated by Google) With fresh ingredients and exquisite saltiness, the hearts and liver are also excellent. The food was delicious no matter what I ate. It's a pity that it took a long time to come out even if I ordered a drink or I couldn't get an order because it might be crowded at a popular shop.  (Original) 新鮮な素材と絶妙な塩加減で、ハツやレバーも絶品。お料理は何を食べても美味しかったす。 人気店で混み合っていることもあるのか、なかなかオーダーをとってもらえなかったり、ドリンクを頼んでも出て来るまで時間がかかったのは残念。
Cool and trendy restaurant, great food and very authentic. Right in the trendy district of Chinatown. We were visiting from out of town but it seems like there were only locals eating there.
The food and service were excellent. Will definitely be back when in town.

Great atmosphere for date night!  Loved all the different options and choices of small plates to try and share.  Especially loved the shishito peppers.  And the chef moves with an art that was fun to watch.  Thought it to be a little over priced for what we got, but overall happy.  Would go back again.
Very good food! Worth visiting!

A MUST VISIT! Premium Yakitori Joint! You wont be disappointed. Ok so let me get this review started.  Location: As you all may know downtown is started to get really hip and revitalized with new shops and a much safer and cleaner area, but one thing that will never change is the difficulties in finding parking. Luckily this place is more of a place to go at night which is perfect because street parking is usually free but you'll be stuck finding spots, may the street parking gods be ever in your favor, otherwise UBER or LYFT "support local side job workers" (Better option if you're going to drink)  Atmosphere: I love how the restaurant was set up and designed, it has that warm ambience and gives you a sense of being in a casual yet classy as if you were in Japan feeling, again it's not like Yakitori Glad or the ones in Japan that has the same vibe as yakitori but this type of yakitori restaurant seems to mimic Tsukuneya kinda vibe but more open seating rather than being enclosed in pods. I love how they don't use electric type grilling from the looks of it it seemed more of actual charcoal grilling couldn't really tell, but you can really tell the difference in the cooking of the skewers.  Food: (The important part most people will read) (Cabbage w/sesame oil is included free/unlimited) So to clear up a few things, unlike Yakitori Glad where you get two skewers for $3.90 you only get one skewer per order which is priced at $2.80 or more (at current January 2017 prices) here. Now that's cleared let's get to whats good. So I and my friend basically ordered one of everything, didn't take a few photos in the beginning because totally forgot and just wanted to have it get in my belly, but these were a few that's worth trying and a MUST TRY:  Hachibei Foie Gras (Chicken Liver): So buttery and creamy, one order is not enough  Enoki Maki!! Mushroom is so good!! It also has a quail egg!  Sunazuri (Chicken Gizzard): A favorite of mine from Yakitori GLAD, and same here, the only difference is that here the gizzard is cooked perfectly and not chewy/rubbery as it often was in GLAD.  Shiso Maki (Perilla Leaves): So good Just try it!. The perilla leaves really have a strong flavor but it works so well.  Bacon & Egg Maki: TRY THIS! its so good, the egg is so good the right amount of sweetness and saltiness from the bacon completes it. Was really good I ordered another one.  Sukiyaki: This was really good! they include an egg yolk for you to dip the skewers, it just works! I had extra yolk so I dipped other skewers in it. Order THIS! -You can also just order the yolk by itself  Tsukune: A staple at any yakitori place, try dipping this in the yolk that comes with the sukiyaki!  Butabara (pork belly): Just order it so good Tara Bara: Same pork belly but this has the tare sauce which is the sweet shoyu sauce  Teba Shio (Chicken Wing): It comes with two wings, it's really moist and crisp, the way its grilled brings out the flavor.  Other things we ordered but was so so..  Mune (Chicken Breast): As with chicken breasts its dry, got the Mantai Mayo, and Wasabi shoyu. The wasabi shoyu flavor wasn't that strong like barely can taste and the mantai mayo was just a few dots of mayo, so wasn't really anything special.  Goma Salmon: Basically salmon poke like the one you get at foodland, I'm not sure if it was just the batch we got, but the salmon was fishy and I know what you're saying, "salmon is a fish" but if you know fishy fish you know what I mean, but it's good, but for the price I rather get the yakitori stuff.  Hachibei Goma Pudding: It's good, just try it there is a very strong smoky sesame taste, but it was interesting  Gelato Vanilla Azuki: Wished they added some kind of mochi ball on the side or something, it was pretty basic dessert.  Customer Service: Customer service was great! The workers were really nice and attentive, they were friendly and the owners like Robert were very welcoming and personable. No questions about service because they are excellent, which is what makes a restaurant just as great.
Great food.  Friendly service. Excellent sake.

For the price and for the service, not worth coming as a native Japanese girl’s opinion. Although my first-timer partner to Yakitori loved the place, I had some problems with how Y.H tries to represent itself as a fancy and trendy restaurant in downtown, which is not a typical concept of Yakitori place is in Japan at all for the most part. So many Japanese places in Hawaii (e.g Ramen) are overpriced and fantasized, and Y.H is definitely one of them.  But ok, I understand if you want to make Yakitori place that is high-end and perfect-for-date restaurant, but then you must train servers with the minimum level of customer service! Our young male server’s reminded me of an impersonal non-friendly cashier at a school cafeteria. In other words, he doesn’t even try to be nice or hospitable to our table. Take order, bring food, that’s it, no other elements of customer service. In fact, when I asked him something he usually just nod and turn around, he never once saw my eyes. He wasn’t horrible, but for what you pay for your food, you can’t even expect the standard pleasant service? Other servers seemed very nice, so maybe we were out of luck.  Quality of food is decent, but which is also relative to what you pay for. Some Happy Hour items were just jokes, because it’s all $5 you get a tiny drop of pâté??? Oh come on. Also we had two different kinds of chuhai, and they are like mock-tail and I could never figure if it has alcohol in it. All dishes come in the size that is smaller than you expect (Also smaller by the standard of Yakitori place in Japan). My love and hate dish of the night was Endoumame no kushiage, which is filled with wonderful pea’s flavor and texture, yet comes in a size of (smaller than) marshmallow and $3.80. Shime’s dishes Oyako-don and Ramen were average. In Yakitori place in Japan, the purpose of shime dishes (end of the meal entry with curb) are to finish meals strong, and they usually condense overwhelmingly rich chicken flavor in broth or with rice, which speaks of the pride of the restaurant. Ramen and Oyako-don missed the special flavors of having them at Yakitori place. The latter had tiniest pieces of chicken I’ve ever seen in Oyako-don.  It was also clear that this place is for Japanese community and Japanese business customers. The owner was present at the restaurant for the entire time when we dined in (I’ve seen him featured in an online article), but he was too busy to be a host of Japanese party of six. Even before the group came, he never checked tables or greet customers, never asked how’s everything going except for his favorite friends’ table. The same thing when you leave the restaurant, this place doesn’t care if you had good time with your meals. I’ve been a host and a server in Japanese restaurants in South Cal and Tokyo, and it’s unimaginable that the owner never say Arigato gozaimashita (thank you for coming in) when customers leave. It feels like that many non-Japanese reviews giving 5 starts to this place don’t know what’s authentic yakitori is, poor thing...
Excellent restaurant with event yakitori... However I'd avoid the wagyu tacos.... 10 bucks for 2 one bite taco are a rip off unfortunately and can't really enjoy the meat quality

Love this restaurant and everything I ate was so delicious.  Staff did a great job from the time I entered until I left.  It really felt like I was back in Japan enjoying yakitori.  Will definitely go back.
Service was good and food was delicious
Food very good, hostes a little rude
So delicious Everyone should try this yummmm

This is the best Yakitori restaurant I've been to in Hawaii.  Unfortunately they're only open for dinner.  Everything I tried was delicious and the cost gets up there (my bill came out to just over $60).  Must tries are: Shiitake Fries, Goma Salmon, Tarebara & Goma Pudding.
It's like being in Japan
Not good in every way.  If you’ve never been to Japan , you would give several stars ..:but still a shame

This is probably the best yakitori restaurant in Hawaii. A little pricey, but the quality is amazing.  It's located on a trendy strip of Hotel Street in downtown Honolulu, but beware, the area gets a little sketchy at night. There are a few public parking lots a couple of blocks away, or take an Uber if you don't want to deal with finding parking and walking.  The standouts for dinner were the tsukune, the eggplant, and the teba karaage (both versions). The mint honey lemon chuhai is a definite must... dangerously smooth.  Will definitely be back, but only for special occasions. Expect to spend about $70 to 80 per head with drinks and tip.
Great food and service
It was soooo delicious

As long as you’re ready to get more than two or three items (it’s a little pricey if you want to be full and really work your way through the menu), it’s definitely worth the investment! Off-menu chicken wings, red snapper, and beef sukiyaki were overwhelmingly amazing. Hard to have a bad time :)

(Translated by Google) When I went last time, I just opened and the service was slow or something different came out, at that time I asked for free and ate what I liked, but I felt it was extremely expensive, but if it was a course, it was the first time in three months that revenge I was going to do it, but it was a course but the serving was slow! You can choose oyster rice bowl and ramen of yakitori course, but both were chosen by two people ... Unfortunately, I don't think it's a oyakodon served by a yakitori restaurant ... Ramen is an instant ramen level. In addition, we are surprised at accounting finally! Stop drinking and have some tea ... you get $ 3.80 a cup ... it was the first in the United States at a Japanese restaurant! Impossible ... How about it instead? That's why there was an alternative tea fee, and it was just $ 16 for ordinary green tea. Service too bad! Never go again! There are other good yakitori shops in Hawaii.  (Original) 前回行った時は、オープンしたばかりでサービスが遅かったり違うものがきたりと、その時はフリーで頼んで好きな物食べて、ものすごく高いと感じたのですがコースならと、3ヶ月ぶりにリベンジのつもりで行ったが、コースなのに料理の提供が遅い！焼き鳥コースのシメの親子丼とラーメンが選べるので両方二人で選んだが… 残念なぐらい、焼き鳥屋の出す親子丼とは思えないレベル…ラーメンはインスタントラーメンレベル…あれなら出さない方がいい！また、最後に会計でびっくり！お酒をやめて、お茶をいただいたら…一杯$3.80くらい取られていて…日本食レストランでアメリカで初めて取られた！ありえない…あげくおかわりどうですか？というから、おかわりしたお茶代も入っていて、普通の緑茶で＄16取られた。サービス悪すぎ！二度と行かない！ Hawaiiには、他にいい焼き鳥屋がります。
Awesome. Great food.
Decent yakitori. Unfortunately we had quite a long wait and it didn't seem like the food was worth it. Faster service and I'd say 4 stars.
Amazing food, service and overall experience!
(Translated by Google) delicious. But it's too expensive for its quantity. More than twice as high as Japan. So three stars  (Original) 美味しい。でも、量を考えると高すぎる。日本より2倍以上高い。それで、星３つ
Excellent place all around!
Yum!!!!  Great for groups, but make reservations.
Yakitori was great here but I felt the variety of skewers wasn't so wide
Great food, price adds up quickly
